name: blastocyst
content:
Add to word list

a blastula (= the early stage of development, consisting of a layer of cells around an empty space) of the embryo of a mammal: Five to six days after an egg is fertilized by a sperm, a tiny ball of cells develops called a blastocyst. The blastocyst cannot support life without being attached to the wall of a uterus. Related word
blastula
More examplesFewer examplesEmbryonic stem cells are taken from a blastocyst - a ball of cells that develops within a few days after an egg has been fertilized by a sperm.There are ethical issues raised by these treatments, such as the disposal of healthy blastocysts.The study concerned the production of viable bovine blastocysts in vitro.They looked at the effect of maternal age on early human embryonic development and blastocyst formation.
